block.p: Dr. Elizabeth Esther Stillwell, a daughter of Ephraim P. Stillwell Jr. of Six Mile, S.C., and the late Jean G. Stillwell, was married yesterday to David Michael Cohen, a son of Phyllis and Joseph L. Cohen of New York. The Rev. Berniece Holt, a Unitarian Universalist minister, performed the ceremony with Rabbi Peter Cohen at the home of the bride's father.

Dr. Stillwell, 35, is keeping her name. She is a research scientist at Memorial Sloan-Kettering Cancer Center in New York. She graduated magna cum laude from Clemson University. She received a master's degree in anthropology from the University of California at Riverside and a Ph.D. in cell biology from Emory University. Her father retired as a professor of physics at Clemson, where her mother was an instructor in geology. The bride is a stepdaughter of Betty C. Stillwell.

Dr. Elizabeth Esther Stillwell, a daughter of Ephraim P. Stillwell Jr. of Six Mile, S.C., and the late Jean G. Stillwell, was married yesterday to David Michael Cohen, a son of Phyllis and Joseph L. Cohen of New York. The Rev. Berniece Holt, a Unitarian Universalist minister, performed the ceremony with Rabbi Peter Cohen at the home of the bride's father.

Dr. Stillwell, 35, is keeping her name. She is a research scientist at Memorial Sloan-Kettering Cancer Center in New York. She graduated magna cum laude from Clemson University. She received a master's degree in anthropology from the University of California at Riverside and a Ph.D. in cell biology from Emory University. Her father retired as a professor of physics at Clemson, where her mother was an instructor in geology. The bride is a stepdaughter of Betty C. Stillwell.

Mr. Cohen, 39, is a partner in Richards & O'Neil, a New York law firm. He graduated magna cum laude from Union College and received his law degree from Fordham. He is a director of Friends and Relatives of Institutionalized Aged, an advocacy group in New York. His parents own Bazaar, a home furnishings store in New York.
